definition: to continue the same old routine/to carry on just as before/to procrastinate
to follow/to adhere to/to abide by
(idiom) to continue in the same old rut/diehard conservative attitudes

sentences.english: At the time he left his homeland, the old ways still held.
sentences.chinese: 他離開中國的時候，人們還在因循舊傳統。

sentences.english: Survial from the water-sprinkling festival, there.
sentences.chinese: 因循下來，從此有啦潑水節。

sentences.english: This is not a question of being more liberal or more conservative.
sentences.chinese: 這個問題無關自由開放還是因循守舊。

sentences.english: We pardon bureaucratic officials and endure bad deeds of security staff.
sentences.chinese: 我們原諒官僚的因循習性，容忍治安人員的惡行惡狀。

sentences.english: While China doesn't follow the rules, India has too many rules to follow.
sentences.chinese: 中國並不循規蹈矩，而印度卻太因循守舊。

sentences.english: The life hacker thinks and acts unconventionally.
sentences.chinese: 生活黑客的想法和行爲則不因循守舊。

sentences.english: Beneath his buttoned-down appearance was a tough mind and a brave heart.
sentences.chinese: 在他那因循守舊的外表下面是堅韌的意志和勇敢的心。

definition: to follow old patterns/to imitate existing models/to continue along the same lines
to hold tight/to cling to/to adhere/stubborn/to detain sb as prisoner
to stick to sth stubbornly/never let go
to be a stickler for formalities/to rigidly adhere to/to cling to/constrained/ill at ease
stick-in-the-mud/to stick to old ways/stubbornly conservative
